title: Moncef Chargui
text:
Moncef Chargui (born 7 August 1958) is a former <a href="Tunisia%20national%20football%20team">Tunisia international</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender who played club football in <a href="Tunisia">Tunisia</a>. He is a football manager and has led clubs in Tunisia and <a href="Bahrain">Bahrain</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Tunisia">Tunisia</a>, Chargui played football in the national league for <a href="Club%20Africain">Club Africain</a>.
Career as manager.
After retiring from playing football, Chargui became a manager. He led <a href="Club%20Africain">Club Africain</a>, <a href="Etoile%20Olympique%20de%20la%20Goulette%20et%20Kram">Etoile Olympique de la Goulette et Kram</a> and <a href="Jendouba%20Sport">Jendouba Sport</a> in the local league before joining Bahraini side <a href="Al-Shabab%20%28Bahrain%29">Al-Shabab</a>. In 2003, he was appointed to replace former Club Africain manager <a href="Muhsin%20Ertu%C4%9Fral">Muhsin Ertuğral</a>, leading the club to the semi-finals of the <a href="2003%20CAF%20Cup">2003 CAF Cup</a>. He joined <a href="Esp%C3%A9rance%20Sportive%20de%20Zarzis">Espérance Sportive de Zarzis</a> in 2007.
International career.
Chargui made several appearances for the <a href="Tunisia%20national%20football%20team">Tunisia national football team</a>, including one <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> qualifying match. He also played for Tunisia at the <a href="1977%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">1977 FIFA World Youth Championship</a> finals in Tunisia.
